properties.name: A climb too far
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild After Uyuni we had a couple of nights here before heading into Peru. One morning I went for a walk and ended up at pukará de quitor with no money on me. I went round the back and climbed about two-thirds of the way up but chickened out and just got dirty coming back down.

properties.name: A couple of nights before Route 40 South
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild We hitchiked across the border from Futaleufu with Juan - a flyfisherman - and Patrick - a rafter. Juan drove us through Welsh-speaking Trevlin to Esquel, where he dropped us at a hostel whose owner he knew. Leaving two nights later, we met Clay at the bus station.

properties.name: A couple of nights with a pool
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild

properties.name: A day in bed
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild After walking through the strike barricades on the road from Arequipa, we slept the ealry morning and some of the afternoon before making the rest of our journey to Qosqo.

properties.name: A hotel somewhere near Xian
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild

properties.name: A night in Osaka
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild

properties.name: Albert Town
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild

properties.name: Alexandrina
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Off an unsealed road, we found a little National campsite in the dark and later saw a hedgehog. Walked up a hill the following morning before heading north.

properties.name: Another lake and volcano
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild First night in a school, second in Casa Azul. A pretty town with a German church.

properties.name: Awesome Falls
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Came from BA and saw Iguazu Falls from the Argentine side. We spotted a cayman, saw coatis for the first time as well as seeing loads of birds and butterflies. The falls themselves were the highlight though. After two nights here, we got a long bus to RIo.

properties.name: Ayahuasca
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild   In a cheap hotel for more than a week l, the latter part of which was spent travelling to km26, taking ayahuasca at night and coming back to rest during the day.

properties.name: Ayahuasca sleep-off
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Spent the night before our 3-night jungle trip doing ayahuasca with Alejandro, an acquaintance of Miguel Tang (whose boat is called "Pituco"). Then slept, did the trip, came back and did another ayahuasca ceremony followed by another mid-morning sleep.

properties.name: BA Stay
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild After a couple of nights at Downtown Maté, we moved into a departamento on Alsina for a month. We took this opportunity to see 5 or 6 Argentinian films, Jun kept studying, and later I met a madre. We nipped into Uruguay during this month and then left for Iguazu Falls and on to Rio.

properties.name: Back Garden Cabaña
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Stayed at 354 Belgrano, in Henry´s back garden, for a month. Jun studied at Patagonia School for 4 weeks and I studied for 1. Met Jo Nicholson as well as other students and teachers and staff at the school.

properties.name: Bag lost - momentary drama
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Two and a half hours walking with full packs from 4am meant that when we got to Qosqo about 10, we were both tired. Jun left her bag (with passports, cash and camera) in the taxi. The guy was honest enough to bring it back an hour later. Phew! Stayed at Hostal Centenario and Julie joined us the following night.

properties.name: Beer but little else
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild  Had high hopes for this little town but apart from enjoying the best fruit beers I´ve ever had, there was not much to say about the place. Another market? Hmmm..

properties.name: Beijing Hotel
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild

properties.name: Between stays
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Hotel Continental wasn´t a bad choice for a place before and after we headed to Coroico and the animal refuge.

properties.name: Bitch at El Buho
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild From Qosqo, we got a night bus to Nazca, saw the lines and then got on a bus to Puno. We agreed a price at hotel El Buho, but the receptionist was a right bitch. After an argument with Julie, she tried to increase our room price, then changed our breakfast. As well as seeing the floating islands, Sillustani and more, we spent time in iPeru complaining about her.

properties.name: Blowholes and Pancake rocks
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild  Saw the sights (but missed the highlights by minutes) at Punakaiki and stayed at the firstof many private campsites. Sat on the beach at night for an hour or two.

properties.name: Cannonvale for Arlie Beach and the Whitsunday Islands
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild

properties.name: Ceniza 331
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild After we had to leave the flat on chaparro, we rented at a place advertised all over town. Jun was volunteering at Aldea Yanapay´s school, I was working at the Irish pub.

properties.name: Cheap Ikebukuro hotel
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Stayed in Ikebukuro and visited Koji in hospital four or five times.

properties.name: Chicha for the first time
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Pleasant Sucre was a colonial treat. The highlight was stumbling on Recoleta Church while indigenous locals were "waiting for the spirit" outside. We sat down and drank and chewed the leaf with them.

properties.name: Cobbled Colonia
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild During our stay in the flat in BA, we came by boat to Uruguay for 2 nights, the first of which we spent in a room next to the shop where the owner worked in Colonia. A pretty town with lots of vintage cars on the street, most of which were defunct.

properties.name: Colonial buildings and museums
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild  A few nights in the capital built in the desert. Saw Pachacamac and a couple of good museums.

properties.name: Corporate parking
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild After our hoped for destination was closed at 8pm, we turned back towards Wellington and stopped in expensive Lower Hutt.

properties.name: Diving the reef
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Stayed in a very nice apartment complex with 3 pools while Jun did her PADI and I dived off a boat called Rum Runner.

properties.name: Fifteen below
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild  I spent the second night of our trip stripping down to naked despite the cold because I was burning up with altitude sickness. The location marker is only an approximation.

properties.name: First night in a campervan
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild We ended up parked in the road outside Anthony and Yulia\'s rented flat. Jun was not impressed.

properties.name: First taste of Bolivia
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild More like a Brazilian city, apparently, Santa Cruz was where we got off a long bus journey from Asuncion, Paraguay. Spent a couple of nights here, enjoyed the feel of the place but didn´t do much.

properties.name: Fitzroy range
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild  After 36 hours on the bus from Esquel, we wanted to sleep. That afternoon we walked up to a view of the FitzRoy range and back.

properties.name: Flags and cables
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild From Rio, we got a twenty hour bus to Foz do Igaçu, crossed the bridge on foot into Paraguay, then caught another bus. Spent a few days in Asuncion, from where we made a day trip to Aregua.

properties.name: Fumaroles and hot springs
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild

properties.name: Gateway to the glacier
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Perito Moreno glacier was awe-inspiring.

properties.name: Gateway to the penguins
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Stayed in a cheap hospedaje on our way to see Humboldts and Magellanic penguins.

properties.name: Grey port
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Waited for the boat here longer than we expected or would have liked.

properties.name: Guilin
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild

properties.name: Ice Encounter
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Another National Parks place, quite basic with no shelter. We saw Fox glacier in the morning and intended to get to Queenstown but stopped here instead.

properties.name: Israeli Party Town
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Kept awake three nights in a row in two different places by "partying" ex-IDFers. Talking loudly and banging tables is a great way to let your hair down and make friends.

properties.name: La Senda Verde
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Volunteered at an animal refuge for 2 weeks, where I dealt with the monkeys and Jun looked after everything else: tortoises, rabbits, guinea pigs, dogs and parrots of every type.

properties.name: Machu Picchu Village
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild  Almost 2 nights at a better-than-advertised (by Lonely Planet) village, where we had a hot bath both evenings only to find out on the second (after visiting Machu Picchu) that there would be not trains the following day due to a strike. Some lying later, we were on the last train back to Ollantaytambo.

properties.name: Near the LoTR Volcanos
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Jun was not feeling well enough for the Tongariro crossing so we did the Silica Rapids walk instead.

properties.name: Near the rock wallabies
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild

properties.name: New Salt Hotel
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild  First night of the tour: stayed in a hotel made of salt near a village on the edge of the flats and were delayed by about two hours in the morning. The location marker is only VERY approximate.

properties.name: New Year 2009 in Currarong
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Stayed with John and a pregnant Therese for 31st Dec and 1st Jan and did some snorkelling.

properties.name: Night in the capital
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild We weren\'t overly impressed with Montevideo, but it was there, so....

properties.name: Our first holiday rental
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild After a couple of nights round the corner on Londres, we rented from an Irishman named Connor. We were on the 21st floor.

properties.name: Palafitos (houses on stilts)
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Went out on a little boat to see the palafitos, which weren\'t quite as colouful as I had expected.

properties.name: Recovery town
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Jun didn´t go to Torres del Paine, citing a cold, and I came back from the national park after one day having come down with something. We spent a few nights in Puerto Natales recovering before a longish bus journey north to El Bolson.

properties.name: Rented a bedsit
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Stayed a few nights before heading to Qosqo to meet Julie - though the strike around Sicuani slowed our progress. Found out about the trouble in the jungle in the north and got a picture published by Al Jazeera from the protest here.

properties.name: Saw our first kea
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Stopped at a national parks campsite, think I saw a kiwi chick walking on the road just before we got here. Cheap and cheerful accomodation with a shelter we could cook in.

properties.name: Sealions
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Lovely little town with sealions and hawks taking advantage of the fish market and a Kunstmann brewery a bus ride away.

properties.name: Sealions and Penguins
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild  Paracas desert meets the Pacific. Great boat trip and tour.

properties.name: Shining Path beginnings
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Hotel Marcos. Ayacucho is said to have 33 colonial churches (one for each year of Jesus´ life) but it was the Museo de la Memoria which made the biggest impact.

properties.name: Some fresh air
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild After two months in La Paz, we had five nights in Coroico, where we went for long walks every day and enjoyed the vultures before going to volunteer at the animal refuge we had heard about in Samaipata a few months previously.

properties.name: The jungle and pueblos
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild The map does not show details of the rivers and villages in the Peruvian Amazon but we spent four days and three nights travelling in this (approximate) region. The first pueblo (night 1) was Saposohillo, where we went crocodile spotting. We spent the second night in the jungle near a lick and the third in a "pueblo libre" (cleared of jungle) called Santa Rosa de Callaria.

properties.name: The night before the flats
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Spent a night here having arranged our 3 day trip for the following day.

properties.name: Thought we were nearer the centre.
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Rented a nice apartment for a couple of days. It was far out, but the beginning of the boat into the harbour.

properties.name: Three nights in extreme town
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Caught up with Anthony and Yulia here and I did "Nevis", New Zealand\'s highest bungee jump.

properties.name: Too much rain to raft
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Hitchiked to and from this little town after Jun refused to stay in Chaiten when we got off the boat. Wanted to raft but the weather and a poor choice of operator prevented it.

properties.name: Town with an enormous cross
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild

properties.name: Triple Towers
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild One night and an 8hr trek to the towers with Jackie and Ximena.

properties.name: Twenty-six nights
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Rented a 3-bed place until 1st Nov and I got a job in "the highest Irish-owned pub in the world" as well as volunteering at a police station in an Aldea Yanapay project.

properties.name: Two months of insufflation
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Rented a two-bed flat on the 12th floor of a café-culture residential area, and spent a lot of time watching YouTube videos and reading about history, religion, evolution, the big bang, abiogenesis and medium´s tricks such as cold-reading and Barnum statements.

properties.name: Two nights in two Nara hostels
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Stayed in a ryokan after the police were called when we tried to leave having pre-booked. The second night was opposite the station.

properties.name: Views of Sugar Loaf
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Andrea and Eduardo put us up for a week after our first night in a dormitory around a couple of corners. Our hosts lent us bicycles and we spent the days getting different views of Christ the Redeemer and the Sugar Loaf. Went to a football match and declared Vasco de Gama my Brazilian team.

properties.name: Villa Jennifer
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild  Danish-Peruvian couple run a great place with caged primates (first time seeing tamarin and marmoset), alligators and birds.

properties.name: Waipara Sleepers
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild  An interesting "station" themed campsite we stayed at after the drive from Lake Alexandrina on the way to Kaikoura.

properties.name: Whale watching
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Saw three sperm whales before setting off for the North Island the following day.

properties.name: With the Matkin-Kosakas
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Stayed at Kahori and Orlando´s for 2 nights and played Geosense with Maya and Mina.

properties.name: World´s largest carved rock
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild   After a rock slide outside Santa Cruz held us up, we arrived in Samaipata in the dark and met Zac on the street. We got a hostel together and stayed with cute kittens (and their fleas) for a couple of nights, seeing the rock, watching Man U lose to Barcelona and dancing at a Mother´s Day party.
